Description: Upper body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery oinochoe or small amphora; exterior: at left, black border with single vertical to its right; in panel, black-figure decoration consisting of middle part of nude male figure with cloak in added red over his left arm, to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 310, no. B322)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0099) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 19)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
